alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:22PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Roosevelt and central Sheridan Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 521 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Plentywood to 9 miles southeast of Archer to 14 miles south of Redstone. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plentywood, Reserve, Antelope, Dagmar and Coalridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
